techmeme.title: Thomson Reuters has won the first major AI copyright case in the US, filed in 2020 against the legal AI startup Ross Intelligence (Kate Knibbs/Wired)
Sources: Altman told staff OpenAI's board has not gotten an official offer from Musk and other investors, and if it happens, the board plans to reject the "bid" (Zoë Schiffer/Wired)
Elon Musk's six companies, which face 32+ ongoing probes, pending complaints, or enforcement actions from 11+ US agencies, score benefits from Trump shake-ups (New York Times)
The bid for OpenAI's nonprofit is top-tier M&A trolling by Musk, as it complicates OpenAI's fundraising by likely altering the cost of equity for new investors (Matt Levine/Bloomberg)
Filing: Binance and the US SEC have jointly asked a judge to stay the regulator's lawsuit against the crypto exchange for 60 days, citing Trump admin changes (Reuters)
